00078 typedef struct config_struct_t
00079 {
00080   
00081   /* Syntax tree */
00082   
00083   list_items * syntax_tree ;
00084 
00085 } config_struct_t ;

00089 /***************************************
00090  * ACCES AUX VARIABLES EXTERNES

00092  
00093 /* fichier d'entree du lexer */
00094 extern FILE * ganesha_yyin;
00095 
00096 /* routine de parsing */
00097 int ganesha_yyparse();
00098 
00099 /* routine de reinitialization */
00100 void ganesha_yyreset(void);
00101 
00102 /* indique le fichier parse (pour la trace en cas d'erreur) */
00103 void ganesha_yy_set_current_file( char * file );
00104 
00105 
00106 /* variable renseignee lors du parsing */
00107 extern list_items * program_result;
00108 
00109 /* message d'erreur */
00110 extern char extern_errormsg[1024];
00111 
00112 /* config_ParseFile:
00113  * Reads the content of a configuration file and
00114  * stores it in a memory structure.
00115  */   
00116 config_file_t config_ParseFile(  char * file_path )
00117 {
00118   
00119   FILE * configuration_file;
00120   config_struct_t * output_struct;
00121   
00122   /* Inits error message */
00123   
00124   extern_errormsg[0] = '\0';
00125   
00126     
00127   /* Sanity check */
00128   
00129   if ( !file_path || !file_path[0] ){
00130     strcpy( extern_errormsg, "Invalid arguments" );
00131     return NULL;
00132   }
00133     
00134   
00135   /* First, opens the file. */
00136   
00137   configuration_file = fopen( file_path, "r" );
00138   
00139   if ( !configuration_file ){
00140     strcpy( extern_errormsg, strerror(errno) );
00141     return NULL;
00142   }
00143   
00144     
00145   /* Then, parse the file. */
00146   program_result = NULL;
00147   
00148   ganesha_yyreset();
00149   
00150   ganesha_yy_set_current_file( file_path );
00151   ganesha_yyin = configuration_file; 
00152   
00153   if (ganesha_yyparse())
00154   {
00155     fclose(configuration_file);
00156     return NULL;
00157   }  
00158 
00162   /* Finally, build the output struct. */
00163   
00164   output_struct = (config_struct_t *)malloc(sizeof(config_struct_t));
00165   
00166   if (!output_struct){
00167     strcpy( extern_errormsg, strerror(errno) );
00168     fclose(configuration_file);
00169     return NULL;    
00170   }
00171   
00172   output_struct->syntax_tree = program_result;
00173   
00174   /* converts pointer to pointer */
00175   fclose(configuration_file);
00176   return (config_file_t) output_struct;
00177     
00178 }
00179

00182 /* If config_ParseFile returns a NULL pointer,
00183  * config_GetErrorMsg returns a detailled message
00184  * to indicate the reason for this error.
00185  */
00186 char * config_GetErrorMsg(){
00187 
00188   return extern_errormsg;
00189   
00190 }

00200 void config_Print( FILE * output, config_file_t config ){
00201   
00202     /* sanity check */
00203     if (!config) return ;
00204     
00205     config_print_list( output, ((config_struct_t *)config)->syntax_tree );
00206     
00207   
00208 }

00214 
00220 void config_Free( config_file_t config ){
00221   
00222   config_struct_t * config_struct = (config_struct_t *)config ;
00223   
00224   if ( !config_struct ) return;
00225   
00226   config_free_list( config_struct->syntax_tree );
00227   
00228   free( config_struct );
00229   
00230   return ;
00231   
00232 }

00236 
00241 int config_GetNbBlocks( config_file_t config ){
00242   
00243   config_struct_t * config_struct = (config_struct_t *)config ;
00244   
00245   if ( !config_struct ) return -EFAULT;
00246   
00247   /* on regarde si la liste est vide */
00248   if ( !(*config_struct->syntax_tree) )
00249   {
00250       return 0;
00251   }
00252   /* on compte le nombre d'elements */
00253   else
00254   {
00255       /* il y a au moins un element : le premier */
00256       generic_item * curr_block = (*config_struct->syntax_tree);
00257       int nb = 1;
00258 
00259       while ( (curr_block = curr_block->next ) != NULL ) {nb++;}
00260 
00261       return nb;
00262   }    
00263 }

00266 /* retrieves a given block from the config file, from its index */
00267 config_item_t config_GetBlockByIndex( config_file_t config , unsigned int block_no )
00268 {
00269    config_struct_t * config_struct = (config_struct_t *)config ;
00270    generic_item * curr_block ;
00271    unsigned int i;
00272    
00273    if ( !config_struct->syntax_tree || !(*config_struct->syntax_tree) )
00274        return NULL;
00275       
00276    for ( i = 0, curr_block = (*config_struct->syntax_tree);
00277          curr_block != NULL;
00278          curr_block = curr_block->next, i++ )
00279    {
00280        if ( i == block_no )
00281            return (config_item_t)curr_block;
00282    }
00283    
00284    /* not found */
00285    return NULL;
00286 }

00289 /* Return the name of a block */
00290 char * config_GetBlockName( config_item_t block )
00291 {
00292    generic_item * curr_block = (generic_item *)block;
00293    
00294    if ( !curr_block || (curr_block->type != TYPE_BLOCK) )
00295         return NULL;
00296     
00297     return curr_block->item.block.block_name;
00298 }

00301 /* Indicates how many items are defines in a block */
00302 int config_GetNbItems( config_item_t block )
00303 {
00304    generic_item * the_block = (generic_item *)block;
00305    
00306    if ( !the_block || (the_block->type != TYPE_BLOCK) )
00307         return -1;
00308    
00309   /* on regarde si la liste est vide */
00310   if ( !(the_block->item.block.block_content) )
00311   {
00312       return 0;
00313   }
00314   /* on compte le nombre d'elements */
00315   else
00316   {
00317       /* il y a au moins un element : le premier */
00318       generic_item * curr_block = the_block->item.block.block_content;
00319       int nb = 1;
00320 
00321       while ( (curr_block = curr_block->next ) != NULL ) {nb++;}
00322 
00323       return nb;
00324   }
00325     
00326 }

00329 /* retrieves a given block from the config file, from its index */
00330 config_item_t config_GetItemByIndex( config_item_t block, unsigned int item_no )
00331 {
00332    generic_item * the_block = (generic_item *)block;
00333    generic_item * curr_item ;
00334    unsigned int i;
00335    
00336    if ( !the_block || (the_block->type != TYPE_BLOCK) )
00337        return NULL;
00338       
00339    for ( i = 0, curr_item = the_block->item.block.block_content;
00340          curr_item != NULL;
00341          curr_item = curr_item->next, i++ )
00342    {
00343        if ( i == item_no )
00344            return (config_item_t)curr_item;
00345    }
00346    
00347    /* not found */
00348    return NULL;
00349 }

00352 
00353 /* indicates which type of item it is */
00354 config_item_type    config_ItemType( config_item_t item )
00355 {
00356     generic_item * the_item = (generic_item *)item;
00357     
00358     if ( the_item->type == TYPE_BLOCK )
00359         return CONFIG_ITEM_BLOCK;
00360     else if ( the_item->type == TYPE_AFFECT )
00361         return CONFIG_ITEM_VAR;
00362     else
00363         return 0;
00364 }

00367 /* Retrieves a key-value peer from a CONFIG_ITEM_VAR */
00368 int config_GetKeyValue(
00369                         config_item_t item,
00370                         char ** var_name,
00371                         char ** var_value
00372                        )
00373 {
00374    generic_item * var = (generic_item *)item;
00375    
00376    if ( !var || (var->type != TYPE_AFFECT) )
00377         return -1;
00378     
00379     *var_name = var->item.affect.varname;
00380     *var_value = var->item.affect.varvalue;
00381     
00382     return 0;
00383 }
00384 
00385 /* get an item from a list with the given name */
00386 static generic_item * GetItemFromList( generic_item * list, const char * name )
00387 {
00388     generic_item * curr;
00389     
00390     if ( !list ) return NULL;
00391     
00392     for ( curr = list; curr != NULL; curr = curr->next )
00393     {
00394         if ( (curr->type == TYPE_BLOCK) && !STRNCMP( curr->item.block.block_name, name, MAXSTRLEN ) )
00395             return curr;
00396         if ( (curr->type == TYPE_AFFECT) && !STRNCMP( curr->item.affect.varname, name, MAXSTRLEN ) )
00397             return curr;
00398     }
00399     /* not found */
00400     return NULL;
00401     
00402 }
00403 
00404 /* Returns the block with the specified name. This name can be "BLOCK::SUBBLOCK::SUBBLOCK" */
00405 config_item_t config_FindItemByName( config_file_t config,
00406                                     const char  * name )
00407 {
00408    config_struct_t * config_struct = (config_struct_t *)config ;
00409    generic_item    * block;
00410    generic_item    * list;
00411    char            * separ;
00412    char            * current;
00413    char              tmp_name[MAXSTRLEN];
00414    
00415    /* connot be found if empty */
00416    if ( !config_struct->syntax_tree || !(*config_struct->syntax_tree) )
00417        return NULL;
00418    
00419    list = *config_struct->syntax_tree ;
00420 
00421    strncpy( tmp_name, name, MAXSTRLEN);
00422    current = tmp_name;
00423    
00424    while ( current )
00425    {    
00426        /* first, split the name into BLOCK/SUBBLOC/SUBBLOC */
00427        separ = strstr(current, "::");
00428        
00429        /* it is a whole name */
00430        if ( !separ )
00431            return (config_item_t)GetItemFromList( list, current );
00432        else
00433        {
00434            /* split the name */
00435            *separ = '\0';
00436            
00437            if ( ( separ - tmp_name ) < MAXSTRLEN-2 )
00438                separ += 2;
00439            else
00440                return NULL; /* overflow */
00441            
00442            block  = GetItemFromList( list, current);
00443            
00444            /* not found or not a block ?*/
00445            if ( !block || (block->type != TYPE_BLOCK) )
00446                return NULL;
00447            
00448            list = block->item.block.block_content;
00449            
00450            /* "::" was found, must have something after */
00451            current = separ;           
00452        }
00453    }
00454    
00455    /* not found */
00456    return NULL;
00457     
00458 }
00459 
00460 
00461 /* Directly returns the value of the key with the specified name.
00462  * This name can be "BLOCK::SUBBLOCK::SUBBLOCK::VARNAME"
00463  */
00464 char * config_FindKeyValueByName( config_file_t config,
00465                                  const char * key_name )
00466 {
00467    generic_item * var; 
00468    
00469    var = (generic_item *)config_FindItemByName( config, key_name );
00470    
00471    if ( !var || (var->type != TYPE_AFFECT ) )
00472        return NULL;
00473    else
00474        return var->item.affect.varvalue;   
00475    
00476 }

00480 
00481 /* Returns a block or variable with the specified name from the given block" */
00482 config_item_t config_GetItemByName( config_item_t block,
00483                                     const char *  name )
00484 {
00485    generic_item    * curr_block = (generic_item *) block;
00486    generic_item    * list;
00487    char            * separ;
00488    char            * current;
00489    char              tmp_name[MAXSTRLEN];
00490    
00491    /* cannot be found if empty or non block */
00492    if ( !curr_block || (curr_block->type != TYPE_BLOCK) )
00493        return NULL;
00494    
00495    list = curr_block->item.block.block_content;
00496            
00497    strncpy( tmp_name, name, MAXSTRLEN);
00498    current = tmp_name;
00499    
00500    while ( current )
00501    {    
00502        /* first, split the name into BLOCK/SUBBLOC/SUBBLOC */
00503        separ = strstr(current, "::");
00504        
00505        /* it is a whole name */
00506        if ( !separ )
00507            return (config_item_t)GetItemFromList( list, current );
00508        else
00509        {
00510            /* split the name */
00511            *separ = '\0';
00512            
00513            if ( (separ - tmp_name) < MAXSTRLEN-2 )
00514                separ += 2;
00515            else
00516                return NULL; /* overflow */
00517            
00518            curr_block  = GetItemFromList( list, current);
00519            
00520            /* not found or not a block ?*/
00521            if ( !curr_block || (curr_block->type != TYPE_BLOCK) )
00522                return NULL;
00523            
00524            list = curr_block->item.block.block_content;
00525            
00526            /* "::" was found, must have something after */
00527            current = separ;           
00528        }
00529    }
00530    
00531    /* not found */
00532    return NULL;
00533     
00534 }
00535 
00536 /* Directly returns the value of the key with the specified name
00537  * relative to the given block.
00538  */
00539 char * config_GetKeyValueByName( config_item_t block,
00540                                  const char * key_name )
00541 {
00542    generic_item * var;
00543    
00544    var = (generic_item *)config_GetItemByName( block, key_name );
00545    
00546    if ( !var || (var->type != TYPE_AFFECT ) )
00547        return NULL;
00548    else
00549        return var->item.affect.varvalue;   
00550 
00551 }
